alert.note: Alert for Dane (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:25PM CDT until July 29 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Dane County in south central Wisconsin... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1025 PM CDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Several reports of flooded roadways around the Madison area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison, Sun Prairie, Fitchburg, Middleton, Waunakee, Verona, McFarland, Monona, Cross Plains, Shorewood Hills, Maple Bluff, UW-Madison, Camp Randall Stadium, Henry Vilas Zoo and Pine Bluff. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
